features: √【SEALED DESIGN MUCH SAFER】Zomchi Blade Bank with its SEALED DESIGN, The used blades can only slip into the bank through the only Opening Gap at the top of the storage case, which could not only avoid escaping of razor blades and effectively protects users getting hurt when disposal the used razor blades, also can keep children safe although they have touched the Blade Bank in case.

√【FRIENDLY DISPOSAL OF USED BLADE】Many our fans are new to switch to safety razors. Finally, this razor blades disposal case comes out, perfectly resolve their puzzlements of abandon the used blades. Find your double edge blades a safety home rather than let them disposed of soil, water, any place that they will hurt creatures alive. Let them go into the new home — the Zomchi blade bank. After scientific recycled, they will refresh a new life like a Phoenix from the Ashes.

√【BIGGER CAPACITY FOR MORE THAN 300 COUNTS USED BLADES】Square shape body has more space to store every count of used blades. So, our blade bank can disposal more blades than the arched shape body. Easy to throw in blades and won't be stuck easily when it is almost full.

√【RECYCLABLE & ZERO-WASTE】This blade bank is made of metal, so it can be totally recycled, the same as the used blades. Shave just the way you are, Replace the blades just the way you are. To replace razor blades frequently is good health for you. You don’t need to worry about waste. There is no waste for a blade’s whole life. When the double edge safety razor blade becomes blunt, it means that the razor blade had finished its job, just let it go!

√【Using Tips】Although our blade bank is SEALED, better to keep away from children to prevent any accidents; When it is almost full, don’t stuff in a blade forcibly and don’t shake the blade case violently to prevent getting hurt and the blades slid out from the gap.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must have item for wet shaving
reviews.reviewText: This is a must have if you use a safety razor. No more worrying about how to dispose of a double edge razor blade. This is a safe way of keeping used blades from going into the trash bin and running the risk of someone getting hurt. When you change your blade drop it in the tin and when it’s full toss it in the recycling bin because it’s made from steel and so are the blades and they are 100 percent recyclable so it’s also eco friendly.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Very pleased with product and service.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great blade bank
reviews.reviewText: I really like this blade bank. It is small enough to not be in the way but large enough to store plenty of blades before tossing in the recycling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This thing is pretty cool. I used to actually put duck tape on my blades to make them safer to dispose of but obviously this is much easier. I'm glad someone came up with this idea.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Modern, Simple, Made in China 4/5 Rating
reviews.reviewText: Made in China. Looks modern. This will rust as it is only aluminum. Good product and it is a good way to recycle razor blades. After it is full you recycle entire container with used blades hidden inside.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Gets the job done; simple clean effective.Cannot be opened without can opener so no one gets hurt.Fill & toss/recycle, done.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars High capacity, but not 300. It's not supposed to be opened or reused.
reviews.reviewText: Great product. I bought one almost two years ago with a new safety razor and 110 blades. It's still got room for more now that I have to buy more blades. It's getting tight though -- I suppose that is mathematically possible given the dimensions of this container and those of the blades, but no, you're not going to actually get 300 blades into this thing unless you can line up everything perfectly without seeing inside of it. I expect that I'll get up to about 120-130 or so before I switch to the new replacement container I'm buying today.Regarding the complaints that this is not openable -- it's not supposed to be. The whole point of this product is to provide a reasonably cheap ($3/year in my case) way to store razor blades and dispose of them safely in bulk. I don't want this to be openable or reusable. By that standard, the product meets all my expectations. While I suppose it may be possible to shake this thing in such a manner as to get a razor to fall or stick out of the slot, you'd almost have to be intentionally trying to do that for it to actually happen.Overall one of my favorite little Amazon purchases. I'm buying my second one today after two years and hope it's still available two years from today.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Simpliclity and Safety
reviews.reviewText: When I was a kid, I accidentally cut myself with a razor. Ever since, I've had this nagging fear of razor blades. I saw this and said, "Yep, get me some of that."This is also most excellent for disposing of box cutter blades, which is our 'delivery economy,' I find myself going through many of those too.
good size, well made blade bank that holds a lot of blades to safely store then dispose of used blades - should last a year or more depending how often you shave

Knapp 10 Euro bezahlt man für diese Aufbewahrungsdose für alte Rasierklingen. Es passen eine große Menge Klingen rein und es dauert lange bis die Dose voll ist. Das Besondere ist dabei, dass man diese Dose nicht öffnet und die Klingen umfüllt und entsorgt sondern diese Dose mit den Klingen entsorgt. Zwei Gedanken sind nun entscheidend. Zum Einen verhindert man Verletzungen beim Umfüllen der gebrauchten Klingen zum Anderen schützt man den Entsorger der mit der Dose in Berührung kommt. Da Dose und Klingen zusammen recycelt werden ist es auch nicht notwendig die Dose und die Klingen zu trennen. Diese Dose funktioniert somit im Recycling Prozess wie ein Mülleimer den man mitsamt dem Müll recycelt. Ich finde diese Methode sicher und nachhaltig da man nur einen Müllkörper produziert und nicht viele einzelne Klingen im Müll rumfliegen hat oder diese in ein Glasgefäß füllt, welches man dann beim Recycling von den Klingen trennen muss.Die Dose ist klein und passt auf jeden Badezimmertisch. Die Bilder zeigen den Größenvergleich mit einer Deo-Dose.Ich kann diese Klingenaufbewahrungsdose absolut empfehlen und werde sie auch wieder kaufen.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on October 16, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Fits nicely and discreet. Stores a good amount
It’s affordable and holds a good amount of used blades, reckon that’s all you need from a blade bank. Looks a lot nicer on my counter than the old Smuckers jam jar I was using for old blades too.
